programme.title: Crikey! Its the Irwins

programme.title: Lone Star Law
programme.desc: The wardens are on high alert at the start of oyster season - and soon come across one crew with a large number of the molluscs. An owl is in need of rescue

programme.title: Dr Jeff: Rocky Mountain Vet
programme.desc: Dr Jeff performs surgery on a dog that cannot keep its food down and weighs 20 pounds less than it should. A cat is brought in with a bloody wound on its side

programme.title: Dr Jeff: Rocky Mountain Vet
programme.desc: Dr Jeff attends a shelter to help the pets of disadvantaged and homeless owners. At the clinic, a dog needs treatment for a growth on its head

programme.title: Pit Bulls and Parolees
programme.desc: Tia presents a behind-the-scenes look at some of her favourite rescues and adoptions from the season, including some never before-seen-footage

programme.title: Pit Bulls and Parolees
programme.sub-title: The Dogs Who Stole Our Hearts
programme.desc: Documentary going behind the scenes of the pit bull shelter, beginning with a look at the dogs that had a major impact on Tias family and the parolees who helped them

programme.title: Insane Pools: Off the Deep End
programme.desc: A couple with a baby ask Lucas Congdon to come to their aid and remodel their outdated pool to make it safe for their young son to be around

programme.title: Insane Pools: Off the Deep End
programme.desc: Lucas is given the task of building a Caribbean-themed pool in a garden, but ends up arguing with his clients over the best way to proceed with the creation

programme.title: Treehouse Masters
programme.desc: Pete Nelson returns to build more spectacular treehouses, beginning with a five-platform structure for a nature preserve in Michigan

programme.title: Saved by the Barn
programme.desc: The team welcomes a blind goat called Charlie and two ducklings. Ginger the goat embraces her new prosthetics and two pigs have a tussle

programme.title: How Do Animals Do That?
programme.desc: Animal facts, including why cows are always chewing, the reason rattlesnakes release their prey and what is the loudest creature on earth. Plus, the sensitive side of rhinos

programme.title: How Do Animals Do That?
programme.desc: The experts reveal why dogs bury bones, whether elephants can detect bombs, who birds sing in the morning and what makes seahorses almost indestructible

programme.title: Extinct or Alive
programme.desc: In Indonesia, Forrest Galante seeks the Millers grizzled langur, or Dracula monkey. When he hears of an illegal pet market, his search becomes a rescue mission

programme.title: The Zoo
programme.desc: The keepers discuss the bonds they form with the animals in the zoo, and reveal how these bonds strengthen their resolve to give them the best care possible

programme.title: Tanked
programme.desc: The CEO of a family-owned winery wants a beautiful reef tank for his living room - and it needs to be done before harvest season

programme.title: Alaska: The Last Frontier
programme.desc: Atz Lee and Charlotte rush to save the life of a cow, and a father-son shrimping trip takes a turn for the deadly following an encounter with a colossal calving glacier

programme.title: Louisiana Law
programme.desc: Agents track down a boat captain breaking the law in Plaquemines Parish. Plus, a family of shrimpers is investigated for pulling oversized nets

programme.title: Louisiana Law
programme.desc: A repeat offender is busted for taking immature crabs and a deer decoy leads to a hunter in handcuffs. Agents investigate a group of bird hunters

programme.title: Mountain Monsters
programme.sub-title: The Secret of the Blue House
programme.desc: After a shocking discovery in West Virginia, the team continues its search for the truth about the Waya Woman

programme.title: Sharks Among Us
programme.desc: Dr Craig OConnell investigates why more people are falling victim to shark attacks, and seeks a way humans and these fearsome marine predators can co-exist peacefully

programme.title: The Flying Gardener
programme.desc: Chris Beardshaw meets keen gardeners Jane and Chris Goodrick from Rhuddlan in Denbighshire, and helps turn their garden into an impressive mixture of plants and shrubs

programme.title: All Creatures Great and Small
programme.desc: James and Siegfried react very differently when the Veterinary Record publishes one of Calums articles. Rural drama based upon the novels of James Herriot, starring Christopher Timothy, Robert Hardy and John McGlynn

programme.title: All Creatures Great and Small
programme.desc: James wins the football pools, and Siegfried visits a farm to treat a sick cat and pulls off a brilliant piece of human diagnosis. Christopher Timothy, Robert Hardy and Lynda Bellingham star

programme.title: The Crime Is Mine
programme.desc: Penniless aspiring actress Madeleine Verdier is surprised to find herself accused of the murder of a powerful theatre producer. Her equally impoverished roommate Pauline Mauleon, an aspiring lawyer, persuades her that a sensational trial is all that is needed to give her career a much-needed boost. French period crime comedy, starring Nadia Tereszkiewicz and Isabelle Huppert

programme.title: Parkinson
programme.desc: Michael Parkinson interviews the American actress, who chats about the fees paid while working on a film, the time the she spent with prostitutes, and her experience of being internationally famous. First broadcast in September 1971

programme.title: Keeping Up Appearances
programme.desc: Richard is forced to think on his feet when he forgets his wedding anniversary and tells Hyacinth he has arranged to have a security alarm fitted as a present. Social-climbing comedy, starring Patricia Routledge and Clive Swift

programme.title: Bookmark
programme.desc: Imaginative re-creation of the day in 1977 when novelist Barbara Pym travelled to London to attend the Booker Prize ceremony. Starring Patricia Routledge, with appearances from Jilly Cooper, Penelope Lively, Hilary Pym, Hazel Holt, Henry Harvey, Tom Maschler and more. First broadcast in 1993

programme.title: Talking Heads
programme.desc: A woman acting as a self-appointed Neighbourhood Watch scheme finds her habit of writing letters to the authorities is getting ridiculously out of hand. Alan Bennetts comic monologue, performed by Patricia Routledge

programme.title: All Creatures Great and Small
programme.desc: James and Siegfried react very differently when the Veterinary Record publishes one of Calums articles. Rural drama based upon the novels of James Herriot, starring Christopher Timothy, Robert Hardy and John McGlynn

programme.title: The Flying Gardener

programme.title: All Creatures Great and Small
programme.desc: James wins the football pools, and Siegfried visits a farm to treat a sick cat and pulls off a brilliant piece of human diagnosis. Christopher Timothy, Robert Hardy and Lynda Bellingham star

programme.title: How to Get Ahead
programme.desc: Writer and broadcaster Stephen Smith explores the flamboyant court of French monarch Louis XIV at the Palace of Versailles, where he surrounded himself with aristocrats, artists, interior designers, gardeners, wig-makers, chefs and musicians. Ambitious courtiers scrambled to get closer to the king, but the bedchamber seemed to provide a more unseemly path to power

programme.title: Fred Dibnahs Age of Steam
programme.desc: The development of steam power, from the earliest experiments in the ancient world to modern-day nuclear power stations. Fred travels to Cornwall to investigate the use of early engines to pump water out of the tin mines

programme.title: BBC Cardiff Singer of the World
programme.sub-title: BBC Cardiff Singer of the World 2025
programme.desc: Gareth Malone and Danielle de Niese host a concert by a line-up of previous BBC Cardiff Singer of the World winners and finalists at the Wales Millennium Centre. From Bizets flirtatious Habanera to Dvoraks much-loved Song to the Moon, to popular arias by Mozart, Verdi, Puccini and more, this is a concert full of musical treats. Performers include soprano Natalya Romaniw, mezzos Catriona Morison and Katarina Karneus, tenor Ilker Arcayurek and baritone Andrei Bondarenko, accompanied by the BBC National Orchestra of Wales under conductor Xu Zhong.

programme.title: The Chatterley Affair
programme.desc: Drama, starring Rafe Spall and Louise Delamere as members of the jury in the 1960 obscenity trial of DH Lawrences Lady Chatterleys Lover. An initial reading of the controversial book stirs unexpected passion in the two jurors, who embark on an affair. With David Tennant, Pip Torrens and Karl Johnson

programme.title: The Age of Uncertainty
programme.desc: John Kenneth Galbraith investigates the impact of Karl Marx on economic interpretation of society, with the revolution he so much wanted not materialising in his lifetime. First broadcast in 1977

programme.title: The Age of Uncertainty
programme.desc: John Kenneth Galbraith traces the impact of colonialism, looking at the potent myths that sustained it and the real motives behind it. First broadcast in 1977

programme.title: Arena
programme.desc: Ian Holm narrates a 1983 profile of the Hollywood star, spanning her life and career from the 1920s to the 1980s, on stage and on screen, and including an interview with Davis herself

programme.title: Arena
programme.desc: Documentary charting jazz musician George Mellys visit to the Hayward Gallery in 1978, where he examines the works on show in a major exhibition on Dada and surrealism. He also talks to some of the last English followers of the movement, including Roland Penrose, before meeting up with rock band the Stranglers

programme.title: Saturday Kitchen Live
programme.desc: Matt Tebbutt is joined by chefs Max Coen and Anna Haugh, and special guest Stephen Fry, for a celebration of World Pasta Day in the studio with Finn Lagun and Roberta dElia. Drinks expert Olly Smith pairs the wines with the studio dishes, and we delve into the BBC food archive

programme.title: Rick Steins Cornwall
programme.desc: Rick delves into the stories of those who worked in Cornwalls mines, from the men who laboured beneath the earths surface to the young women who earned their living breaking rocks with heavy sledgehammers. He also visits a maker of botanical spirits, and adds a cheeky nip to his clementine trifle

programme.title: Live International Rugby League
programme.desc: England v Australia (Kick-off 2.30pm). Coverage of the opening fixture in the three-match Ashes series, which takes place at Wembley Stadium. This is the first series to take place since 2003, when the visiting Kangaroos won all three matches in Wigan, Hull, and Huddersfield, respectively, ensuring they claimed the Ashes for a 13th consecutive time

programme.title: Strictly Come Dancing
programme.desc: Tess Daly and Claudia Winkleman present Icons Week, in which the celebrities - minus Chris Robshaw and Stefan Dennis - perform routines that honour some of the most influential music artists of all time. Judges Shirley Ballas, Craig Revel Horwood, Motsi Mabuse and Anton Du Beke offer their opinions before the public vote opens

programme.title: Michael McIntyres The Wheel
programme.desc: The comedian hosts the game show in which contestants answer questions with the aid of celebrity experts - aware that one wrong answer means someone else gets a chance. The celebrities are Susan Wokoma, Roman Kemp, Layton Williams, Katherine Ryan, Jill Scott, Joe Marler, Steve Pemberton and Reece Shearsmith

programme.title: Nine Bodies in a Mexican Morgue
programme.desc: Air authorities search for the plane, and federal agencies spring into action. As the group becomes smaller, the last survivors know they are going to have to fight to stay alive

programme.title: Match of the Day
programme.desc: Highlights of the latest Premier League matches, including Chelsea v Sunderland at Stamford Bridge, and Brentford v Liverpool at Gtech Community Stadium. The Blues and Black Cats had identical records prior to the most recent international break, suggesting their encounter would be closer than the 5-1 victory Chelsea recorded when they last hosted Sunderland in 2017. Meanwhile, the Bees were looking to halt a run of five consecutive losses against the Reds. Plus, action from Newcastle United v Fulham, and Manchester United v Brighton and Hove Albion

programme.title: The Football Interview

programme.desc: John and Quiet make a pitstop, where John reunites with a former contact. Sweet Tooth bonds with a new follower

programme.title: Twisted Metal

programme.title: The Graham Norton Show
programme.desc: The host is joined by reality star and businesswoman Kim Kardashian and award-winning actress Sarah Paulson, who are appearing together in the new TV legal drama Alls Fair. Breaking Bad star Bryan Cranston chats about taking to the West End stage in All My Sons, while actress and singer Rachel Zegler also appears, fresh from wowing audiences at the London Palladium in Evita. Plus, Little Simz performs Lion, from her album Lotus

programme.desc: The International Sunday Service from the City Church, Cardiff, a weekly gathering that brings together people from diverse cultures for worship, biblical teaching and reflection. The principal contributor is senior pastor Stephen Gibson, who introduces viewers to the Christian Pentecostal faith and the community

programme.title: Songs of Praise
programme.desc: Sean Fletcher chats to Gospel singer-songwriter Muyiwa Olarewaju, as he shares his extraordinary faith journey and chooses his favourite hymns and worship songs.

programme.title: Points of View
programme.desc: Viewers opinions on BBC shows and behind-the-scenes reports on new programmes

programme.title: Blue Planet II
programme.desc: Footage of marine life in different environments around the north, beginning with a tropical coral reef which has medicinal properties for dolphins, and is used as a tool by tusk fish. In Japan, a shipwreck is home to the Asian sheephead wrasse, which can change gender, while in the polar north, walruses struggle to find ice floes for their pups to rest on as climate change takes its toll on the environment

programme.title: Hamzas Hidden Wild Isles
programme.desc: Hamza Yassin records wildlife around the UK during summer, travelling from the vast open ocean of the Irish sea to the heart of Leeds and his remote home on Scotlands west coast. Along the way, he encounters a two-metre long blue shark, pregnant greater horseshoe bats, a pod of common dolphins, and wild beavers, which have been missing from Britain for the past 400 years

programme.title: The Witches
programme.desc: In 1967, an orphaned boy goes to live with his grandmother, only to find himself the prey of diabolical witches disguised as glamorous women. Heading to a seaside hotel seems like a great way to escape, but in an unfortunate twist of fate, the worlds Grand High Witch is gathering her coven at the same resort, and has a nefarious plan in store. Co-writer/director Robert Zemeckiss take on the beloved Roald Dahl fantasy, starring Anne Hathaway, Octavia Spencer and Stanley Tucci, and narrated by Chris Rock

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Weather
programme.desc: The latest forecast

programme.title: Countryfile
programme.desc: Anita Rani and Sean Fletcher explore the Chatsworth Estate in Derbyshire, where gardeners, foresters, farmers and volunteers are using new methods to reimagine the grounds. Plus, Charlotte Smith investigates the impact of the governments incoming changes to inheritance tax that are already being felt by farming

programme.title: Hamzas Hidden Wild Isles
programme.desc: In Autumn, Hamza heads to the south Devon coast to spot Atlantic bluefin tuna, and pays a night-time visit to Londons Highgate Cemetery in search of urban foxes. He also explores a cave system in Northern Ireland, where experts have discovered a hidden species of cave spiders and a fungus that turns the underground arachnids into zombies

programme.title: Strictly Come Dancing
programme.desc: Tess Daly and Claudia Winkleman present the results of Icons Week, with two more couples finding themselves one dance-off away from losing their place in next weeks Halloween spectacular. The professionals perform a tribute to Britney Spears, and Rachel Zegler sings Dont Cry for Me Argentina

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow
programme.desc: Fiona Bruce presents a final visit to Stephens House and Gardens in Finchley, North London. Finds include a letter written by the Duke of Wellington before the Battle of Waterloo, some artwork by early 20th-century illustrator and creator of whimsical cartoon machines Heath Robinson, and paintings by Pakistani artist Tassaduq Sohail. Plus, FIona puts her knowledge of European porcelain to the test

programme.title: Riot Women
programme.desc: Struggling to process the shock of her discovery, Kitty teeters on the verge on a nervous breakdown, leading to an explosive Sunday lunch round at Beths house. Jess writes one song about ungrateful children, Yvonne writes another about the traumas of giving birth, and Hollys promising date turns into an excruciating encounter in the bedroom

programme.title: Match of the Day
programme.desc: Highlights of the latest Premier League matches, including Arsenal v Crystal Palace at Emirates Stadium, and Everton v Tottenham Hotspur at Hill Dickinson Stadium. Palace were looking to bring an end to an eight-game winless run against the Gunners, dating back to the 2021/22 season, while Spurs sought an away win over the Toffees for the first time since 2018. Plus, action from Bournemouth v Nottingham Forest, Aston Villa v Manchester City, and Wolverhampton Wanderers v Burnley

programme.title: Scream
programme.desc: The students of a high school are stalked by a masked knife-wielding maniac with a love of scary movies and a penchant for playing mind games with his prey. One of the girls on his hit list begins to suspect there is a connection between the killer and her mothers murder a year previously. Wes Cravens horror, which satirises the genres cliches, starring Neve Campbell, David Arquette and Courteney Cox

programme.title: Weather for the Week Ahead
programme.desc: A look ahead to the latest forecast

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: Nigel prepares to sell his beloved car, but accidentally damages it in the process. Later he makes a reckless decision that has serious consequences. George grows concerned about Kojos whereabouts, and Kat is consumed with worry for her family

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: After an odd text from Harrys phone, Teddy shares his worries with Billy. Meanwhile, Okie is fuming at Harry and insists he calls Kojo to tell him to return to the handlers. Nigel reels from his actions, Kat makes a worrying discovery, and Johnny considers a new business venture

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: The events of the accident play on Nigels mind, and Julie attempts to conceal the truth. Meanwhile, Kat follows Zoe to a clandestine meet with a private investigator to confront her about the stolen money

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: Its tense between Kat and Zoe, but their attention soon turns to a cat trapped in the Vic. Zoe makes amends with her mum, but then drops a bombshell. Nigel is determined for the truth to come out, and Billy is irked when Johnny tries to win Lexis affection with gifts

programme.title: Gavin and Stacey
programme.desc: The bride-to-be goes on a hen party, while Gavin embarks on two stag nights, the second of which reveals shocking secrets about his fiancee that could jeopardise the wedding. Elsewhere, the early return of Staceys brother Jason horrifies Uncle Bryn. Comedy, starring Mathew Horne and Joanna Page

programme.title: Gavin and Stacey
programme.desc: The day of the wedding arrives and Bryn is still behaving oddly around Staceys brother. Nessa debates whether to share her big secret and Smithy resolves to give a superb best mans speech - but finds himself overcome with emotion under the spotlight. Mathew Horne and Joanna Page star

programme.title: Daddy Issues
programme.desc: When hedonistic 24-year-old Gemma discovers she is pregnant after a one-night stand, she has no choice but to turn to her hapless father, Malcolm, for support. A sweet-but-lost man in a domestic crisis, he must learn to rebuild his relationship with his daughter, though they soon find living together will prove difficult. Sitcom, starring Aimee Lou Wood and David Morrissey

programme.title: Daddy Issues
programme.desc: Gemma realises she needs more female support. After a chance encounter with an old friend, Gemma agrees to go to a party to try and reconnect with girls from school. She suggests Malcolm finds a normal friend after Derek tries to convince him that close-up magic is the way to a womans heart

programme.title: RuPauls Drag Race UK
programme.desc: Reality competition in which contestants fight to be crowned the next superstar drag queen continues with the queens taking to the high seas for a cruise-themed talent show. Derry Girl Jamie-Lee ODonnell joins RuPaul, Michelle Visage and Alan Carr on the judging panel

programme.title: BBC New Comedy Awards
programme.desc: The ultimate hunt for the best new British comic begins as 30 hopefuls battle it out across six heats to earn a place at the Final, where one will be crowned the BBC New Comedian of 2025. Josh Jones hosts the West heat at St Georges, a multi-purpose, fully accessible live music and arts venue in the heart of Bristol. Carwyn Blayney, Will Owen, Omari Douglas, Jess Carrivick and Alfie Dundas take to the stage in a bid to impress judges Priya Hall, Harriet Dyer and Fatiha El-Ghorri

programme.title: BBC New Comedy Awards
programme.desc: Sarah Keyworth hosts, as second heat contenders Eli Hart, Farhan Solo, Chloe Reynolds, Will BF and Monica Hsueh take to the stage of Birminghams Hockley Social Club in a bid to book their place in the final. Head judge Fatiha El-Ghorri is joined in her ranks by comedian, writer and podcaster Aurie Styla and local Brum stand-up Lindsey Santoro

programme.title: Two Pints of Lager and a Packet of Crisps
programme.desc: Gaz reacts to the misery of Donna leaving him by binge eating. Jonny gets a job working in the pub, while his house receives a much-needed tidy, courtesy of Louises group of teenage delinquents - who provide Janet with an opportunity to work on developing that all-important maternal instinct

programme.title: Two Pints of Lager and a Packet of Crisps
programme.desc: Gaz is run over by an ambulance, making Donna realise she still loves him. However, while concussed, he confesses to being the father of Janets baby - which sends a furious Jonny storming off to the maternity ward in search of answers. Meanwhile, Louise worries about her career prospects

programme.title: Two Pints of Lager and a Packet of Crisps
programme.desc: Janet struggles to remember things, so Louise signs her up for a pub quiz to keep her mind active. However, she gets wrapped up in the competition and forgets her antenatal class - prompting Gaz to accompany Jonny in her place. Comedy, starring Sheridan Smith

programme.title: Scooby-Doo! Mystery Incorporated
programme.desc: Fred, Daphne, Velma and Shaggy join the canine detective to investigate reports that Crystal Cove is being tormented by an evil man-baby called Crybaby Clown

programme.desc: Its all laughter and disaster for Scooby and the gang, in these best pranks!

programme.desc: The cowardly hound and his Mystery Machine companions find their winter holidays interrupted when a sinister living snowman begins to torment the owners of a local toy store. However, as Scooby and the gang investigate, they find themselves trapped within the shops factory, with their frozen adversary lying in wait. Animated mystery adventure, with the voice of Matthew Lillard

programme.title: Scooby-Doo! The Sword and the Scoob
programme.desc: Scooby-Doo and the gang journey back in time to help King Arthur save his throne from an evil sorceress.

programme.title: Whats New Scooby-Doo?
programme.desc: Join the gang for awesome chases and thrilling scares in these monster themed adventures!

programme.sub-title: Scooby-Doo, Dog Wonder!/The Legend Of The Gold Microphone!
programme.desc: The gang, with help from Blue Falcon and his dog wonder, Dynomutt, are on the case of a Medusa Monster that’s stealing priceless vases from millionaire art collectors. / Our mystery teens work with Joseph “Run” Simmons originally of Run DMC to get to the bottom of a mystery.

programme.title: Whats New Scooby-Doo?
programme.sub-title: Fright House of a Light House / Go West Young Scoob
programme.desc: Cartoon capers with the mystery-solving canine and his friends

programme.title: Whats New Scooby-Doo?
programme.desc: Join Scooby and the gang as they embark on epic mysteries, featuring some of the menacing monsters around!

programme.title: Scooby-Doo! Mystery Incorporated
programme.sub-title: The House of the Nightmare Witch
programme.desc: Velma and Hotdog Water work for Mr E to retrieve a museum exhibit from Moscow, which comes to life and torments Crystal Cove

programme.sub-title: Dance Matron of Mayhem!/The Wedding Witch Of Wainsly Hall!
programme.desc: Famous dancer Maddie Ziegler wins an old, haunted dance studio in a competition. / Scooby and our gang of mystery solving teens have been invited by famous comedian Jeff Foxworthy to help him move an old mansion that hes just purchased.

programme.title: Whats New Scooby-Doo?
programme.sub-title: Space Ape At The Cape/3-D Struction

programme.title: My World Kitchen
programme.desc: Sebastiaans making a South African bobotie, which is a local dish his family have shared with him. He starts by putting chopped spring onions, grated courgette, turmeric powder, ground coriander and torn red pepper into a casserole dish and cooking them. He then adds garlic puree, ginger puree, chutney and chopped tomatoes to cooked beef mince. Sebastiaan then carefully makes powder out of his special ingredient, cumin seeds, and adds the powder to the beef mixture. Sebastiaan mixes both the vegetables and the beef in an oven dish and flattens them before adding two bay leaves. He adds a topping of milk and egg and then places it in the oven. Sebastiaan has a wonderfully decorated table, and he has another traditional treat to go with his bobotie. Will his friends figure out what his special ingredient is?

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Homer is recruited to be a church deacon by the trendy new reverend - but when he starts to embrace the faith a little too seriously, Bart asks Flanders to help him track down their former pastor, the Rev Lovejoy. programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Marge encourages Bart to explore his creative side and signs him up for piano lessons, but the youngster is less than enthusiastic about the prospect until he meets his Russian teacher Zhenya. programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The competition kicks off in Portsmouth at the Seacrest Hotel, where owner Antoinette Stretton and general manager Carmen Cretu hope their experience will set them apart

programme.title: Four in a Bed

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The third visit of the week takes place at Deri-Down Guesthouse in Abergavenny, Wales, where husbands and wife Mike and Del Hayward hope to impress their rivals

programme.title: Four in a Bed

programme.title: Four in a Bed

After opinions are aired and differences debated, the payments are revealed and the winner is announced

programme.title: George Clarkes Amazing Spaces
programme.desc: In Denmark, George meets a young couple tackling the enormous task of turning a derelict water pumping station into a luxury holiday home. Meanwhile, a dedicated outdoor swimmer builds himself a futurist micro camper. George and Will come up with a novel way to pick the colours for their elegant sky cabin, Will Hardie visits a glamping pod built in an upturned boat, and George visits one up a tree in a Danish forest

programme.title: The Great British Bake Off

As always, Paul Hollywood and Prue Leith taste their efforts - but who will make it through to next weeks semi-final?

programme.title: Channel 4 News

programme.title: Bettany Hughes Treasures of the World
programme.desc: Bettany uncovers some of Bulgarias rich cultural and historical treasures when she explores the Belogradchik Rocks and the storied prehistoric paintings of Magura Cave. In Sozopol, she dives with archaeologists to reveal ancient underwater ruins, and at Deultum, she discovers Bulgarias earliest Christian traces, before celebrating Orthodox Easter in Veliko Tarnovo and Bachkovo Monastery

programme.title: Great British Train Journeys from Above

Seen from above, the rail route reveals how George Stephensons steam revolution changed people, land, industry and trade for ever

programme.title: The Equalizer

programme.title: Widows

programme.desc: Documentary exploring evidence that Edward VIII may have collaborated with the Nazis following his abdication in 1936, as well as the establishment cover-up of his loyalties that occurred following the war. Historians examine the possibility that the former king may have passed information to known spies and been complicit in a plot to reinstate him to the throne in the event of Britain being successfully occupied

programme.title: Guy Martin: The British Train that Changed the World
programme.desc: Guy Martin celebrates the 200th anniversary of the earliest passenger trains first journey along the Stockton and Darlington Railway. For over a year, Guy helps with the re-build of a replica of the original locomotive, and exactly 200 years after that historic trip, Guy joins the crew on the footplate of Locomotion No 1 as it sets out once more on the 26-mile journey

programme.title: Live: NFL Big Game Night
programme.desc: Philadelphia Eagles v New York Giants (Kick-off 5.00pm). Dermot OLeary, Sam Quek, and Osi Umenyiora present coverage of the week eight match at Lincoln Financial Field, as the NFC East rivals meet for the second time this season. The Giants claimed a 34-17 victory in the previous encounter, which served as the Thursday Night Football game in week six, with rookies Jaxon Dart and Cam Skattebo being the star performers. Skattebo ran for three touchdowns while amassing 98 yards on 19 carries, while Dart threw for 195 yards, including one touchdown, while also reaching the end zone on his feet with a 20-yard rush. Tonights coverage will also feature the game within a game quiz element, whenever the NFL game stops in the US

programme.desc: A profile of socialite Wallis Simpson, focusing on her early years before she met the future Edward VIII, asking whether she was a scheming seductress or one of the most maligned women in history. Her first marriage, to a heavy-drinking US naval officer, was a tempestuous on-off relationship, and in 1928, she married her first British husband, Ernest Aldrich Simpson, an English-American shipping executive. However, it wasnt until three years later that she was introduced to the Prince of Wales at an event at Burrough Court - a meeting that was to spark an infamous period in British history

programme.title: Couples Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Couples from the West Midlands compete for the cash prize of £1,000. First to host are Sam and Karl, with a 1980s-inspired menu. programme.title: Couples Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: In the West Midlands, the first hosts, Rosie and Darren, who love to live the good life, are hoping that their menu of homegrown classics will wow their guests. Jamie and Alison also serve up homegrown goodies, while flamboyant final night hosts Sean and Helen intrigue everyone

programme.title: Couples Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: In south-east London, kicking off the week are business owner Max and his wife, professional singer Janelle, whose family roots are behind a complex Caribbean menu. programme.title: Ramsays Kitchen Nightmares USA

programme.desc: Gordon Ramsay revisits three restaurants he tried to save - Handlebar, Casa Roma and the Black Pearl - to find out whether his advice has been put to good use

programme.title: Ramsays Kitchen Nightmares USA

programme.desc: Gordon Ramsay visits Down City, a restaurant in Providence, Rhode Island. The eaterys co-owner and financier begs Gordon to return, but his success hinges on his ability to win Abby over

programme.title: Ramsays Kitchen Nightmares USA

The pub is owned by Karen and her husband Christian, who admit that they have little idea how to run a restaurant. Chef Michael has complete control of the kitchen and the menu, but his area of expertise is Puerto Rican food and he thinks that British cuisine is bland. programme.title: The Goldbergs

programme.title: David Attenboroughs Natural Curiosities

programme.title: David Attenboroughs Natural Curiosities
programme.desc: The surprising preventive and curative medicine developed by certain species, including the hippopotamus, which secretes a red slime to act as a highly efficient sun screen

programme.title: David Attenboroughs Natural Curiosities
programme.desc: Two families with remarkable powers of regenerating unusually large body parts easily - salamanders, which do so when a large chunk, such as the tail or a limb, has been bitten off by a predator, and male moose, which grow and shed antlers every year

programme.title: Babe: Pig in the City
programme.desc: The pig and his farmyard pals take a trip to the big city, where their curiosity and love of adventure lands them in trouble, leaving the courageous Babe to find a way to save his chums from danger. Family comedy sequel, starring Magda Szubanski, Mickey Rooney and James Cromwell, and featuring the voice of Elizabeth Daily as Babe

programme.title: The SpongeBob Movie: Sponge Out of Water
programme.desc: The cheery sea creature tries to prevent a precious secret formula from falling into the wrong hands - but when it goes missing, the end of the world approaches. SpongeBob and his friends embark on a quest to get it back, which leads to them developing superpowers and venturing onto dry land. Animated comedy, with the voices of Tom Kenny and Antonio Banderas

programme.title: Home Alone
programme.desc: A boy has to fend for himself when he is accidentally left behind after his family jets off to Paris for Christmas. The youngster initially enjoys his freedom, but is soon forced to resort to ingenious booby traps to defend the family home from two dim-witted burglars. Comedy, starring Macaulay Culkin, Joe Pesci, Daniel Stern, John Heard, Catherine OHara and John Candy

programme.title: Last Night in Soho Interview Special
programme.desc: Director Edgar Wright and co-writer Krysty Wilson-Cairns discuss travelling through time and recreating the past to make the atmospheric psychological thriller Last Night in Soho

programme.title: Playing with Fire
programme.desc: A straight-laced fire superintendent and his elite team of expert firefighters come to the rescue of three siblings in the path of an encroaching wildfire, but quickly realise that no amount of training could prepare them for their most challenging job yet - as their babysitters. Comedy, starring John Cena, Keegan-Michael Key and John Leguizamo

programme.title: Deep Impact
programme.desc: A TV reporter investigating a presidential misdemeanour stumbles on evidence that a comet is on a collision course with Earth, threatening the future of the human race. Meanwhile, an astronaut prepares to lead his crew on a do-or-die mission to intercept the danger. Sci-fi drama, starring Robert Duvall, Tea Leoni, Morgan Freeman and Elijah Wood

programme.title: The Popes Exorcist
programme.desc: Father Gabriele Amorth, chief exorcist of the Vatican, investigates a rundown abbey in San Sebastian. The owner, Julia, claims her 12-year-old son Henry has been possessed by a demon. Local priest Father Esquibel is unprepared to tackle the profanity-spewing malevolence, so Amorth lends his years of experience to the case. Horror, starring Russell Crowe and Daniel Zovatto

programme.title: Pearl
programme.desc: In 1918 Texas, teenager Pearl dreams of becoming a dancer in Hollywood in direct opposition to her domineering German immigrant mother. The projectionist of the local cinema fans the flames of the teenagers rebellion and mother and daughter clash violently. Horror, starring Mia Goth and David Corenswet

programme.title: Smile
programme.desc: Dr Rose Cotter works in the emergency psychiatric unit of a busy hospital, tending to troubled patients including a new arrival, Laura Weaver. After witnessing a traumatic incident involving Laura, Rose becomes convinced she is being threatened by an uncanny entity. Horror, starring Sosie Bacon, Kyle Gallner and Jessie T Usher

programme.title: Tora! Tora! Tora!
programme.desc: Fact-based Second World War drama recounting the bombing of Pearl Harbour from both the Japanese and American perspectives, reconstructing the events leading up to the devastating attack on the US naval base in 1941. Starring Martin Balsam, So Yamamura, Joseph Cotten, James Whitmore and Jason Robards

programme.title: Last Night in Soho Interview Special
programme.desc: Director Edgar Wright and co-writer Krysty Wilson-Cairns discuss travelling through time and recreating the past to make the atmospheric psychological thriller Last Night in Soho

programme.title: Spider-Man: Into the Spider-Verse
programme.desc: After being bitten by a radioactive arachnid, student Miles Morales develops incredible abilities, and becomes a version of Spider-Man. When a super collider device opens a gateway to other dimensions, Miles crosses paths with five counterparts to stop a threat for all realities. Oscar-winning animated adventure, with the voices of Shameik Moore and Nicolas Cage

programme.title: Sister Act 2: Back in the Habit
programme.desc: A cabaret singer who once hid out in a convent is reunited with the nuns she befriended, who now need her help. She poses as a member of the order once more and joins the staff of a Catholic school threatened with closure, where she aims to make a success of the resident choir. Comedy sequel, starring Whoopi Goldberg, Kathy Najimy, Lauryn Hill, Maggie Smith and James Coburn

programme.title: Hidden Figures
programme.desc: As the space race reaches fever pitch in the early 1960s, a trio of female African-American mathematicians attempt to overcome prejudice and find work with NASA. Their remarkable skills prove vital in getting an astronaut into orbit and bringing him safely back to Earth, but to realise their potential they must overcome deep-seated prejudice in the space programme and society as a whole. Fact-based drama, starring Taraji P Henson, Octavia Spencer, Janelle Monae and Kevin Costner

programme.title: Ticket to Paradise
programme.desc: Divorced couple David and Georgia fake civility for the sake of their daughter, Lily. During a post-graduation trip to Bali, Lily falls in love with a handsome local called Gede, and the young couple hastily decide to marry. With four days until the nuptials, David and Georgia secretly agree a truce to carry out an underhand plan to break up the couple so Lily doesnt make the same mistake as them. Director Ol Parkers comedy romance, starring George Clooney, Julia Roberts and Kaitlyn Dever

programme.title: Venom: Let There Be Carnage
programme.desc: Struggling to cope with his alter ego Venom, Eddie Brock attempts to re-ignite his journalistic career by interviewing serial killer Cletus Kasady. However, Kasady becomes the host of the symbiote Carnage and escapes prison after a failed execution. Comic-book fantasy sequel, directed by Andy Serkis and starring Tom Hardy, Woody Harrelson and Michelle Williams

programme.title: The House of Mirth
programme.desc: A spirited woman in 1920s New York dreams of marrying a wealthy man. Her desire for riches leads her to ignore her feelings for a poverty-stricken friend, and instead embark on a whirlwind tour of high society - but the machinations of another woman make her a pariah. Director Terence Daviess drama, based on the novel by Edith Wharton, starring Gillian Anderson, Eric Stoltz and Dan Aykroyd

programme.title: Sabata
programme.desc: Corrupt town elders secretly mastermind a plot to steal a shipment of gold from the army, and use it to take control of a stretch of land where a railway is being built. However, an implacable gunslinger is soon coming after them to dish out his own brand of justice. Spaghetti Western, starring Lee Van Cleef, William Berger and Pedro Sanchez. Dubbed in English

Western, starring John Wayne, Robert Mitchum, James Caan and Ed Asner

programme.title: The Comancheros

programme.desc: England Women v Brazil Women (Kick-off 5.30pm). Seema Jaswal is joined by Ian Wright and Anita Asante to present coverage of the international friendly at Etihad Stadium in Manchester. These nations last met in the 2023 Womens Finalissima at Wembley, where England, the European Champions, defeated the South American Champions on penalties after the game ended in a 1-1 draw. Two years later, both teams once again hold their respective continental titles, with England having won the UEFA Womens Championship twice and Brazil now the nine-time champions of the Copa America Femenina. With commentary by Seb Hutchinson and Lucy Ward, and reports from Katie Shanahan

programme.desc: Two grieving widows lay rival claims to a corpse found washed up on the beach, each insisting it is the body of her missing husband. programme.title: Agatha Christies Poirot
programme.desc: A dentist falls in love with his young assistant. His anxious wife, believing he has made plans to poison her and thereby remove the main obstacle to happiness, calls for Poirots help. Drama, starring David Suchet

programme.title: Lewis
programme.desc: The inspector and his sidekick DS Hathaway investigate the murder of a talented maths student. The prime suspect is the victims ex-boyfriend, who is convinced his uncle has set him up, but old case papers belonging to Morse reveal the boys family is hiding a dark secret. Laurence Fox and Rebecca Front co-star alongside Kevin Whately

programme.title: Lewis
programme.desc: Oxfords last-surviving all-female college is holding a reunion to bid farewell to one of its most prominent professors. However, the evening leads to tragedy when a guest is found murdered, and Lewis is convinced the killing is connected to an attack that occurred at the same institution 10 years previously. The detective calls in his former DS, Alison McLennan, to help with the investigation, but the case takes a twist when two more bodies turn up. Crime drama, guest starring Juliet Stevenson and Saskia Reeves, with Kevin Whately and Laurence Fox

programme.title: Agatha Christies Marple
programme.desc: A series of scandals makes for an interesting few days in the quiet village of St Mary Mead, and most seem to revolve around a blustering local colonel, whose brusque manner and short temper make him unpopular with his fellow villagers. When he is found dead with a bullet through the head, Miss Marple and the reluctant DI Slack investigate. Whodunit, starring Geraldine McEwan as Miss Marple, with Jane Asher, Jason Flemying, Derek Jacobi and Miriam Margolyes

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: When a woman is drowned in a bath and made to look like a bride, with a chilling lipstick message on the bathroom mirror, it triggers a spate of ghoulish wedding-themed murders in Great Worthy. The case takes Barnaby and Jones to a donkey sanctuary, a heritage steam railway and a pub run by an ex-policeman and former brothel madam as they try to identify the killer. Guest starring Pam Ferris (Rosemary and Thyme) and Kacey Ainsworth (formerly EastEnders Little Mo)

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: The life of an eccentric and reclusive couple comes under police scrutiny when a social services investigator is killed, and Barnaby must unearth generations of family secrets and decipher astronomical charts to find the murderer. Meanwhile, the detectives wife Sarah (Fiona Dolman, The Royal Today) arrives in Midsomer as the new head of a local school. Drama, starring Neil Dudgeon and Jason Hughes, with Phyllida Law, Edward Fox and Neil Pearson

programme.title: Vera
programme.desc: A mother of two is found murdered in her back garden. Vera and Aiden investigate the case, and delve into the disturbing secrets and ongoing conflicts that lurk beneath the surface of the victims seemingly peaceful suburban community. The case takes a more complicated turn when the dead womans estranged family make an unexpected reappearance, and while several of her neighbours may have had cause to carry out a crime of passion, her relatives may have had compelling motives of their own to kill. Guest starring Rita Tushingham

programme.title: Vera
programme.desc: The detective investigates when a seemingly beloved resident of a coastal community is fatally driven off the road, and realises she has to dig up the victims past to have any chance of unmasking the killer. Joined by her faithful team, including DC Kenny Lockhart and new recruit DC Jac Williams, Vera attempts to find the missing link that will crack the case, but finds it difficult to get to the truth when everyone they encounter seems to be protecting a secret. Crime drama based on Ann Cleeves series of novels, starring Brenda Blethyn

programme.desc: An American female bishop visiting St Gerards College is found dead after drinking poisoned wine, and when another two killings occur, both mirroring macabre murders from Jacobean revenge tragedy, it appears the culprit is targeting candidates in the election to become vice-regent. However, when Innocent learns one of the suspects is hiding a dark secret, Lewis and Hathaway realise the motive is much more twisted. programme.title: Downton Abbey
programme.desc: An exciting offer for Edith divides opinion, Isobel throws Ethel a lifeline and Annas perseverance finally pays off. Costume drama, starring Laura Carmichael, Penelope Wilton, Amy Nuttall, Joanne Froggatt and Dan Stevens

programme.title: Downton Abbey
programme.desc: Tempers fray as a kind gesture by Isobel backfires, while Mary fights Bransons corner when his decisions are put under scrutiny. Robert and Coras relationship is under pressure, but can Violet make them see things differently? Bates goes to extreme lengths as his chance of freedom slips away. Costume drama, starring Penelope Wilton, Hugh Bonneville and Elizabeth McGovern

programme.title: Downton Abbey
programme.desc: Its a happy day for Downton as Annas patience is rewarded, while Edith receives admiration from an unexpected quarter. Matthew refuses to back down over the estate management, but will his tactics pay off? Bransons plan for the christening causes consternation, as does the arrival of his brother, and OBriens motives are unclear as she counsels Thomas. Julian Fellowes period drama, starring Joanne Froggatt, Laura Carmichael, Dan Stevens and Allen Leech

programme.title: Downton Abbey
programme.desc: There is excitement throughout the house and nearby village as the annual cricket match draws near, and the event brings out Roberts competitive side. Violets great-niece Rose arrives, but a trip to London reveals there is more to her than meets the eye, while Matthew and Mary seem to be keeping secrets from each other. Thomass future appears to be uncertain, but he may have found an unexpected ally in Bates

programme.title: Downton Abbey
programme.desc: In the Christmas special from 2012, Robert and his family make their annual summer visit to his Scottish cousins at Duneagle Castle, leaving most of their servants at home. Edith discovers newspaper editor Michael Gregson is also on holiday in the area and may not be there just for the sketching and fishing, while personal servant OBrien finds a kindred spirit below stairs in the form of her opposite number. Meanwhile, at Downton, Carson faces the task of keeping the staff focused on their work polishing the silverware and cleaning, but with the Granthams hundreds of miles away, minds begin to wander to other things, including the forthcoming Thirsk Country Fair

programme.title: Endeavour
programme.desc: When a respectable GP is found dead in a public lavatory, the young Morses outlandish theories see him relegated to general duties by the newly arrived Chief Superintendent Bright. Humiliated and humbled, Endeavour has to investigate from the sidelines, but its not long before hes questioning DI Fred Thursdays orders and risking his career to avert a family tragedy. Shaun Evans stars, with Roger Allam, Anton Lesser, Sean Rigby and James Bradshaw

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Bullard asks Barnaby to investigate the disappearance of a friends daughter who was a member of the Oblong Foundation, a cult based at Malham Hall. Jones goes under cover as a new recruit to solve the mystery, but he and Barnaby soon start digging into an old case involving the death of a couple in a boat explosion, which could be linked to the missing woman. Detective drama, starring Neil Dudgeon and Jason Hughes, with Will Knightley, Kevin Doyle, Holly Aird, Barbara Flynn and John Woodvine

programme.title: Vera
programme.desc: The dead body of a teenage boy is found in a reservoir near a remote rural timber community. Vera and her team investigate, and discover that the boy had already been missing for three days prior to his death. However, the case is complicated by an apparent conspiracy of silence, as many of the townsfolk refuse to cooperate with the police investigation. A complex web of relationships between the victims friends and family slowly emerges, with many dark secrets that could have driven someone to kill

programme.title: The Hack
programme.desc: Nick fights to protect his editor and his newspaper from a Fleet Street backlash. A new clue surfaces that could further prove phone hacking by senior Murdoch editors. programme.title: The Hack

programme.desc: In Dublins city centre, Oliver Bond Celtic FC welcomes the Total Football team, as Shamrock Rovers senior ladies take on skillful young reporters

programme.title: The Next Step
programme.desc: A-Troupe prepares for the internationals livestream challenge. Reality-style drama, following the lives of a group of dancers

programme.title: The Next Step
programme.desc: Ariana faces a difficult decision during the internationals livestream challenge. Reality-style drama, following the lives of a group of dancers

programme.title: news2day Weekly
programme.desc: The stories making the headlines both at home and abroad during the past seven days

programme.title: Home and Away
programme.desc: Mali makes big plans to cheer John up, Harper prepares for her date, but avoids mentioning this to Tane. Also, Alf stops by Davids new home

programme.title: Home and Away
programme.desc: John opens up to Mali and Tane, Jo confronts Lacey, and the Langhams settle in

programme.title: A Christmas Hero
programme.desc: When a young disillusioned war vet sees nothing good in his life during Christmas, a visit by his guardian angel shows him that his life really did make a difference. Drama, starring Michael Welch

programme.title: Monarch of the Glen
programme.desc: A mysterious traveller arrives in Glenbogle with some questions about his past, leading to a secret being unearthed. Meanwhile, Lexie resolves to prove herself by making the Ghillies Ball a success, but when her plans for a traditional Highland celebration are scuppered she decides to organise an event in her own unique style

programme.title: Monarch of the Glen
programme.desc: Archie tries to keep Pauls revelation that he is Hectors son a secret, hoping to protect Molly. But Lexie is determined they should face up to the reality of the situation sooner rather than later and persuades Paul to stay at Glenbogle until the dust has settled

programme.title: Wild West: Americas Great Frontier
programme.desc: A journey along Americas West coast. The programme examines how the landscape is shaped by the Pacific Ocean as well as powerful forces beneath ground, particularly along the San Andreas Fault. The programme also visits the warm and sheltered waters of the Sea of Cortez, where animals including blue whales gather, and discovers how a small community in Americas westernmost point have a unique relationship with grey whales

programme.title: Wilderness with Simon Reeve
programme.desc: Simon voyages across the Coral Triangle, a huge wilderness of tropical seas and jungle clad islands in the south-western Pacific, surrounded by the Philippines, Malaysia and Indonesia. It is one of the most beautiful and biodiverse corners of the words oceans and is crucial to the health of the wider marine environment, having been described as the Amazon of the seas

programme.title: Big Cats 24/7
programme.desc: Vianet Djenguet follows lioness Matho as she struggles to raise her cubs alone, while Tristen Woodward and Brad Bestelink get a glimpse of Xudum the leopards newborn cubs, but dangerous males loom nearby. With competition growing from the enormous lion pride, Anna Dimitriadis tracks a cheetah mother to the very edge of the territory, where she has been pushed to keep her cubs alive

programme.title: The Future of Nature
programme.desc: A look at how forest ecosystems reduce global carbon levels and effect climate, meeting the people working to improve biodiversity, saving keystone species and using Indigenous wisdom to rebuild and restore our forests

programme.title: The Americas
programme.desc: The wildlife of the Andes, including southern Perus marbled four-eyed frog, which is capable of freezing solid and reviving daily, captured on film for the first time. In Ecuador, a mother bear and her cubs navigate a dangerous rock face, while high in the mountains, flamingos perform mating dances on crimson lakes. The rare spatuletail hummingbirds, with only 500 males left, engage in intense competition

programme.title: Blood Diamond
programme.desc: Smuggler Danny Archer ends up in prison in war-torn Sierra Leone in 1999, where he meets Solomon, a Mende fisherman separated from his family by guerrillas. Danny pledges to help the desperate man rescue his son, who has been forcibly conscripted as a child soldier, in return for a rare pink diamond that Solomon had hidden away before his capture. Action thriller, starring Leonardo DiCaprio, Djimon Hounsou and Jennifer Connelly

programme.title: Rise of the Nazis
programme.desc: The return of the documentary, picking up in the immediate aftermath of the Second World War, when the Allies uncovered the scale of the Holocaust. Preparations began for a trial at Nuremberg, where 22 of the highest-ranking Nazis, including Hermann Goering, were to face charges of war crimes and crimes against humanity. But not all the highest-ranking Nazis had been captured, and the job of tracking them down fell to Allied soldiers

programme.title: A Good Girls Guide to Murder
programme.desc: The disappearance of 17-year-old Andie Bell has haunted the town of Little Kilton for five years, a confessional text pointed the blame at her boyfriend Sal after he took his own life. Now, inquisitive teenage amateur sleuth Pip Fitz-Amobi is determined to clear his name and get to the bottom of what really happened. Crime drama based on the novel by Holly Jackson, starring Emma Myers and Zain Iqbal

programme.title: Invisible Boys
programme.desc: Caught in the crossfire of familial duty, Matt wants to support his father, who may be experiencing early onset dementia as Matt himself struggles with depression

programme.title: EuroNews
programme.desc: European and international headlines live via satellite

programme.title: South Pacific
programme.desc: A naval nurse falls in love with a French plantation owner on an American-held island during the Second World War. However, dark secrets surface from his past and result in her having to leave the colony and embark on a perilous mission with the help of a US Navy officer. Romantic musical based on the Rodgers and Hammerstein Broadway show, with Mitzi Gaynor, Rossano Brazzi, John Kerr and Ray Walston

programme.title: Tales of the Unexpected
programme.desc: A man plots to get rid of his demanding wife and inherit her money. Starring Anthony Franciosa and Shirley Knight-Temple

programme.title: Tales of the Unexpected
programme.desc: A hitman is taken in by his intended victims hospitality - but it is a harsh lesson that can only be learnt once. Starring Eli Wallach and Anthony Pullen Shaw

programme.title: Tales of the Unexpected
programme.desc: A man invents a machine that enables him to talk to plants - with unexpected consequences. Harry Andrews stars

programme.title: Tales of the Unexpected
programme.sub-title: Never Speak Ill of the Dead
programme.desc: Two friends suspect a doctor of murdering his wife and disposing of her body in a cellar. Starring Colin Blakely and Warren Clarke

programme.title: Tales of the Unexpected
programme.desc: An accountant whose book-keeping is perfect finds his honesty being put to the test

programme.title: The Alfred Hitchcock Hour
programme.desc: After serving a prison sentence, a man romances the woman whose false testimony got him convicted. Drama, starring Bradford Dillman and Barbara Barrie

programme.title: The Alfred Hitchcock Hour

programme.title: Julie Andrews Forever
programme.desc: A look at the career of the Oscar-winning actress, who starred in The Sound of Music and Mary Poppins

programme.title: Classic Movies: The Story Of

programme.desc: Ian Nathan looks at Michael Powell and Emeric Pressburgers 1943 anti-war satire that follows a soldier as a he rises through the ranks in the British military

programme.desc: A June 2011 concert by the singer, recorded on the final night of his So Beautiful or So What tour, which saw him playing at small clubs and theatres across the USA. Featuring songs including The Obvious Child, Kodachrome, Gone at Last, Mother and Child Reunion, Dazzling Blue, Rewrite and The Afterlife

programme.title: Classic Albums
programme.sub-title: Meat Loaf - Bat Out of Hell
programme.desc: The story behind Meat Loafs phenomenally successful 1977 album Bat Out of Hell, charting record companies initial indifference toward the stars powerful lyrics and theatrical style

programme.title: Classic Albums
programme.desc: Insight into the making of Elvis Presleys 1956 self-titled debut album, featuring contributions by some of the original supporting musicians, as well as friends and colleagues including Keith Richards and BB King. The programme includes footage of Presley performing classic tracks such as Heartbreak Hotel and Blue Suede Shoes, and examines the records production

programme.title: Elvis Presley: The Early Years
programme.desc: A look at the singers journey from poverty in Mississippi to worldwide fame, revealing the highs and lows in a tale of passion, perseverance and the birth of rock n roll

programme.title: Elvis: Summer of 56

programme.title: When Elvis Met Priscilla
programme.desc: In 1959, 24-year-old Elvis met 14-year-old Priscilla at a party at his villa in Bad Nauheim, West Germany, which he had rented during his military service. This documentary details their turbulent courtship, marriage and divorce

programme.title: Elvis Presley: Aloha from Hawaii
programme.desc: A 1973 concert featuring Elvis Presley singing 25 of his greatest hits, including Blue Suede Shoes, Hound Dog and Suspicious Minds. The film was a milestone in music history, originally transmitted live around the world via satellite

programme.title: Roy Orbison Forever
programme.desc: Documentary celebrating the singer-songwriter, charting his career and relationships with other musicians through interviews and archive performances. Featuring interviews with Elvis Costello, Tom Petty, Bono, Gerry Marsden, Jeff Lynne, Olivia Harrison and Barbara Orbison

programme.title: Classic Albums

Theyre joined for a jam session by country music superstar guitarist Vince Gill

programme.title: United Kingdom of Pop
programme.desc: Part one of two. A look at key figures and movements in British pop culture, as well as the most important political, cultural and economic events that were reflected in it

programme.title: Discovering Music
programme.desc: Friends and fans of Queen discuss their admiration for the rock band and reflect on the groups career and music

programme.title: Discovering Music

programme.desc: A devious woman meets her match when she tries to take advantage of a struggling artist

programme.title: Tales of the Unexpected
programme.desc: A wealthy mans wife plans to murder him - but her astute husband proves more ruthless than she bargained for. Starring Telly Savalas and Rita Gam

programme.title: Tales of the Unexpected
programme.desc: An ordinary married couple inherit a fortune that has a dramatic effect on their lives. Starring Frank Finlay and Heather Sears

programme.title: Tales of the Unexpected
programme.desc: Friendships are pushed to their limits when two school chums decide to share a house. Starring Rachael Kempson and Joan Greenwood

programme.title: The Alfred Hitchcock Hour
programme.desc: The wife of an inveterate gambler tells him to either give up poker or else she will leave him. Starring Gig Young, Martha Hyer and Robert Redford

programme.desc: A profile of the Marilyn Monroe from her own perspective, told through the interviews she gave, the books she wrote and the fragments she left behind

programme.desc: Paul Gambaccini narrates a documentary celebrating the life of the Texan singer-songwriter, who began his career opening for Elvis Presley and became a star in his own right

programme.desc: Documentary charting the success of the Californian pop group, featuring performance, archive footage and interviews with the band members. programme.title: Elton John: Million Dollar Piano
programme.desc: The musician plays a selection of his greatest hits, recorded during his residency at the Colosseum at Caesars Palace, Las Vegas. Featuring performances of Rocket Man, Crocodile Rock, Tiny Dancer, Goodbye Yellow Brick Road, Im Still Standing and Circle of Life

programme.title: Classic Albums
programme.desc: Musicians and rock historians discuss the making of Creams groundbreaking 1967 album Disraeli Gears. Recorded in just six days at Atlantic Records studios in New York, it was produced by Felix Pappalardi and set the seal on the bands fame

programme.title: Arts Most
programme.desc: Art critic Waldemar Januszczak explores three of arts most controversial and important subjects. He begins by travelling from Japan to India to find the most sexually explicit art ever made, asking why artist have always been so interested in sex

programme.title: Arts Most
programme.desc: Waldemar Januszczak confronts terrifying artistic displays of blood, gore and death, and wonders why art is so obsessed with horror

programme.title: Arts Most

programme.title: Classic Movies: The Story Of
programme.sub-title: The Life and Death Of Colonel Blimp
programme.desc: Ian Nathan looks at Michael Powell and Emeric Pressburgers 1943 anti-war satire that follows a soldier as a he rises through the ranks in the British military

programme.desc: Documentary capturing the actresss spirit and determination, combining new and archive footage to tell the story of a true Hollywood star who won four Academy Awards
