Locked in and faced with a dangerous armed robber wearing a Father Christmas mask, they have to come up with an escape plan. But will Lees poorly conceived ideas get them into even more trouble? One-off Christmas special of the comedy, starring Lee Mack and Sally Bretton

programme.desc: Leslie is dismayed to learn the Pawnee library has submitted a bid to take over Lot 48, which she was planning to turn into a park. But when his famous American co-star has an accident on set, Toast finds his own role, playing a villainous rival, has terrifying consequences. Meanwhile, the actors ex-wife Ellen has become engaged to Stirling Porrich, a wealthy Devon crisp manufacturer, and hes determined to stop the wedding at all costs. Guest starring Matthew Holness and Amanda Donohoe

programme.title: The Cleaner
programme.desc: Wicky is called to a quiet town where someone has thrown a bucket of blood over a statue at the middle of a protest. Unfortunately, as he sets about cleaning it up, it becomes clear that the row is far from over and he finds himself embroiled in a debate that looks like it might turn nasty. Zoe Wanamaker, Susannah Fielding and Louis Emerick guest star

programme.title: The Good Life

programme.desc: A retired jeweller offers Del-Boy the deal of a lifetime - then suddenly has a heart attack and gets taken to hospital with a briefcase containing 250 cut-price gold necklaces still chained to his wrist. Comedy, starring David Jason and Nicholas Lyndhurst

programme.title: Only Fools and Horses
programme.desc: Del enters one of Rodneys old paintings in a competition and is over the moon when he wins a holiday for three at a five-star hotel in Majorca. Soon after, the Trotter brothers and Cassandra arrive at Palma Airport - but Del-Boy reveals there is a slight snag. Comedy, starring David Jason, Nicholas Lyndhurst and Gwyneth Strong

programme.title: Only Fools and Horses
programme.desc: Dels beloved mum apparently makes contact during a seance at the Nags Head, inspiring him to visit the doctor to seek treatment for stomach cramps. Admitted to hospital for tests, he fears there is something seriously wrong with him - but a bacon sandwich and an alcoholic drink smuggled in by Rodney soon put the smile back on his face. Comedy, with David Jason, Nicholas Lyndhurst and Buster Merryfield

programme.title: Only Fools and Horses
programme.desc: Rodney ties the knot with Cassandra, but Del has more on his mind than best man duties as the dreaded Driscoll brothers arrive at the Nags Head baying for his blood over some stolen mobile phones. Comedy, starring David Jason, Nicholas Lyndhurst and Gwyneth Strong

programme.title: Only Fools and Horses
programme.desc: Del-Boy enters the import trade after striking a deal with Boycie to fetch a consignment of dodgy diamonds across from Holland, and ropes in Rodney and Uncle Albert to help. Their plans are jeopardised when old foe Chief Inspector Slater picks up the Trotters trail. Feature-length episode of the comedy, guest starring Jim Broadbent, with David Jason, Nicholas Lyndhurst and Buster Merryfield

programme.title: Only Fools and Horses
programme.sub-title: Miami Twice - Part One: The American Dream
programme.desc: Part one of two. The Trotters get a chance to escape Peckham for a holiday in the Florida sun - but it means Del leaving his newborn son behind. David Jason and Nicholas Lyndhurst star, with Buster Merryfield, Tessa Peake-Jones, Gwyneth Strong, Denis Lill and Roger Lloyd Pack

programme.title: Only Fools and Horses
programme.sub-title: Miami Twice - Part Two: Oh to Be in England
programme.desc: Part two of two. The Trotters arrive in Florida, and walk straight into disaster after their camper van is burgled and local Mafiosi take a shine to Del-Boy, who bears more than a passing resemblance to their boss. What Del does not know is that they are planning to have him killed as a way of faking the godfathers death to help him escape being sent to prison. Feature-length episode of the comedy, starring David Jason and Nicholas Lyndhurst, with a cameo appearance by Bee Gee Barry Gibb

programme.title: Only Fools and Horses

Feature-length episode of the comedy, guest starring Jim Broadbent, with David Jason, Nicholas Lyndhurst and Buster Merryfield

programme.title: Dads Army
programme.desc: Mainwaring lands himself in trouble with Warden Hodges, accused of leaving a light burning in the church hall during a blackout, and receives a summons to appear in court. Comedy first aired in 1972, starring Arthur Lowe and Bill Pertwee

programme.title: The Good Life
programme.desc: Margo is horrified by the prospect of dressing in saucy clothes for her music societys production of Sweet Charity, and Tom discovers oil in his garden. Classic comedy, starring Richard Briers and Penelope Keith

programme.title: The Good Life
programme.desc: Margo has a burglar alarm installed, but Tom and Barbara claim they have nothing left worth stealing. Jerry is convinced he has failed to succeed his boss as head of the firm, and the Goods decide that despite all their problems, they are glad they became self-sufficient. Seventies comedy, starring Penelope Keith and Richard Briers

programme.title: The Good Life
programme.desc: Tom Good decides he has had enough of commuting - but his solution to the problem causes embarrassment among the well-to-do neighbours. First episode of the classic comedy, starring Richard Briers, Felicity Kendal, Paul Eddington and Penelope Keith

programme.title: The Good Life
programme.desc: Tom and Barbara introduce livestock into Surbiton - an idea that does not go down too well with the neighbours. Comedy, starring Richard Briers and Felicity Kendal

programme.title: Men Behaving Badly
programme.desc: Gary realises it is high time he got rid of his moth-eaten, flea-ridden, beer-soaked sofa of 25 years - leading to a trip down memory lane reliving his youth, his first day at work and his meeting with Dorothy. Tony makes an unwise purchase when he buys a snake from a man in the pub

programme.title: Bottom: Hooligans Island Live 1997
programme.desc: Manic flatmates Eddie and Richie are marooned on a desert island - with only a nuclear bomb for company

programme.title: Toast of London
programme.desc: When Jane promises Steven a major part in a big-budget film to be shot in Britain, hes hugely excited. But when his famous American co-star has an accident on set, Toast finds his own role, playing a villainous rival, has terrifying consequences. Meanwhile, the actors ex-wife Ellen has become engaged to Stirling Porrich, a wealthy Devon crisp manufacturer, and hes determined to stop the wedding at all costs. Guest starring Matthew Holness and Amanda Donohoe

programme.title: Toast of London
programme.desc: Steven is reunited with an old flame he hasnt seen since they starred together in an American soap opera back in the 1980s. Now married to Josh Homme of the rock band Queens of the Stone Age, is Lorna still in love with Toast, or simply using him to make her husband jealous? The tormented actor seeks refuge in the home of his old friend Francis Bacon, who everyone seems to think is dead. Guest starring Morgana Robinson and Steve Pemberton

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Neil is badly let down by one of his regular informants when a family jewellers is robbed of half a million pounds worth of stock and one of the partners is shot in the course of the crime. Phil plays the knight in shining armour for casino owners wife Monica Dreyfuss when she turns up in custody drunk and unable to pay her restaurant bill

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: A worried mother reports her son missing after a night out clubbing, but finds it difficult to accept he is gay when it emerges he has been beaten and raped following an assignation with a casual pick-up. Emma and Sally have some success persuading the troubled youngster to unburden himself and Neil jumps to the conclusion the lads own friends may have had something to do with the attack

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Terry investigates a loan shark accused of using strong-arm tactics to collect the extortionate repayments she demands. Stories about her employing a vicious thug to make acid attacks on the families of debtors prove all too true and Beth finds herself in danger when the ruffian is cornered. Meanwhile, a Ukrainian woman with no passport or visa is taken to hospital following a road accident but runs away before Sally can get the full story

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Smithy picks up a lead on a drug dealer operating from a burger van and before long Sun Hills uniform branch are mounting a raid on a skunk factory - where Diane puts herself in great danger by ignoring Callums orders. Back at the station, Phil and Stuart muster as much empathy and sensitivity as they can when CID are called on to sort out a love triangle and find a missing bridegroom in time for his wedding

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: First of a two-part story. The body of missing schoolgirl Chloe Parks is found at a derelict site, but Crime Scene Examiner Lorna Hart cannot confirm the cause of death. Suspicion immediately falls on the victims boyfriend, who seems to be responsible for recent changes in her behaviour, but a chilling home video given to the police by a classmate changes the direction of the investigation. Chris Walker guest stars. Concludes tomorrow

programme.title: Tipping Point
programme.desc: Ben Shephard hosts the quiz in which contestants answer questions to win turns on an arcade-style machine. Dropping tokens down a choice of four chutes, they hope to knock piles of them off a moving shelf - and the more they collect, the greater the prize fund. The player who has won the least amount is then eliminated, and the last one standing competes for a £10,000 jackpot

programme.title: Ambulance Australia
programme.desc: A peek behind the scenes at the busiest ambulance service in Sydney. Advanced care paramedics Shelly and Shane help the victim of a hit-and-run incident, while Tamara and Jeff race across Brisbane to the aid of a woman in labour

programme.title: Ambulance Australia
programme.desc: Armahn and Ash are called to help a 96-year-old woman who has a nasty head injury, while Paul gives a unique pep talk to ease the concerns of a panicking patient

programme.title: Ambulance Australia
programme.desc: Advanced paramedics Sam and CJ come to the aid of a woman who is having a diabetic seizure, then are sent to help a young boy with breathing difficulties

programme.title: Ambulance Australia
programme.desc: Advanced paramedics Rachel and Ben treat a man who has a burning pain in his eyes, while Tash helps a woman who is trapped in her car following a head-on car crash

programme.title: Pete Wicks: For Dogs Sake
programme.sub-title: Terri, Esme and the Chi Family
programme.desc: Pete meets Lurcher Terri, whos terrified of the world and must learn to trust again, and helps settle a family of chihuahuas given up by their heartbroken owner

programme.title: The Supervet
programme.desc: A 10-month-old puppy called Albie is knocked over by a car on a family camping holiday is rushed in as an emergency admission, and Noel Fitzpatrick fears this may be a life or death situation. Elsewhere, a Scottish terrier has a mysterious ailment, and a 16-month-old spaniel, is suffering from severe arthritis affecting both hips

programme.title: One Born: What Happened Next?
programme.desc: Documentary revisiting some of One Born Every Minutes most memorable parents, including Nina and Andy, who already had two children and thought their nappy days were behind them, until they discovered they were expecting twins. Paul and Ines overcame a 30-year age gap and cultural differences to make their marriage work, but now face a different test with three youngsters to look after. Theres also a chance to catch up with Sarah and Nando, whose first baby Gino fell ill just after his birth, pushing their relationship to breaking point

programme.title: One Born: What Happened Next?
programme.desc: Documentary revisiting some of One Born Every Minutes most memorable parents, including Vicki and Janet who are experiencing the terrible twos with daughter Eva, yet face another challenge as Vicki prepares to undergo IVF treatment again. Single mother Sasha from Latvia had to go through the birth of her baby boy Rupert alone when her mother couldnt make it to the hospital in time, and was determined to bring him up by herself. However, she is now back at work and seeking extra help

programme.title: Bradford on Duty
programme.desc: More than 28 per cent of Bradfords residents are aged under 18, a higher proportion than any other city in the UK. Cameras focus on the police, fire service and council as they battle to protect Britains youngest city from anti-social behaviour and work with the community to improve relationships

programme.title: Inside the Ambulance
programme.desc: Jo and Ash deal with a patient whose chronic cough leaves him struggling to breathe, while Joel and Nic treat a man whos fallen from a ladder while wielding a hedge trimmer

programme.title: Interior Design Masters with Alan Carr
programme.desc: The two finalists go head to head, each taking on the redesign of a trendy bar in Londons vibrant Soho district. They have three days to make over the ground-floor bar and an intimate basement cocktail lounge - and to help, both contestants have a fellow team-mate, plus a team of trades. One designer goes all-out, relocating the bar to the other side of the room - but the more they rip out, the more it becomes a demolition zone. Down the road, there is indecision and angst as the other finalist realises just how much is at stake. Who will win the career-defining contract to design an upmarket apartment on the Cornish coast?

programme.title: Amanda and Alans Italian Job
programme.desc: Amanda Holden and Alan Carr join forces to renovate the last two rooms. Their dream of creating an open plan living and dining room is dented when they discover the main structural wall dividing the two spaces requires a much smaller arch than they anticipated. For this final space, they agree to put their design differences to one side, but a disagreement over the shape of the arch threatens to divide them. Away from the task, the duo take a boat trip along the stunning Zingaro nature reserve to get inspiration from the Sicilian landscape, and enjoy sunset on horseback in the ancient Greek city of Selinunte

programme.title: Louis Theroux - A Place for Paedophiles
programme.desc: The broadcaster reports from Coalinga State Hospital in California, home to more than 500 sex offenders, many of whom have already served lengthy prison sentences and are deemed unsafe for release. During his visit, Louis finds out about a therapy programme run by psychologists who hope to rehabilitate willing participants - but many inmates refuse to take part, with only 13 having completed the course since it began

programme.title: One Born Every Minute
programme.desc: The documentary focuses on two women hoping to have natural births. Staff induce an 18-year-old expectant mother who is nine days overdue, but become concerned about the struggle she faces with the delivery of her large baby. Meanwhile, a 35-year-old overweight woman at risk of complications due to her size is taken to theatre, as her husband waits anxiously for news

programme.title: One Born Every Minute
programme.desc: A couple who are expecting their fifth son disagree over whether they should have more offspring in the future, and a father-to-be who was adopted reveals that, despite his financial restraints, he cannot imagine being parted from his child. Plus, a woman prepares to give birth while coming to terms with the recent loss of her father

programme.title: One Born Every Minute
programme.desc: A woman carrying triplets is booked for an emergency Caesarean two months before her due date, but staff have just 30 minutes to carry out the delivery when one of the babies shows signs of distress. Meanwhile, a couple about to become parents for the first time are told their childs heartbeat is dipping, and immediate action must be taken

programme.title: One Born Every Minute
programme.desc: In a One Born Every Minute special, cameras follow four couples through their multiple pregnancies and births. Ana and Paul are thrilled at the prospect of becoming first-time parents to triplets, but receive worrying news at a routine scan, while Beth has to have emergency laser surgery in her womb after her babies are diagnosed with twin-to-twin transfusion syndrome. Carolyne and Gordon, already parents to four children, are shocked to discover they can expect three more, while Sophie and Carlos try to cope with the premature arrival of their two daughters

programme.title: One Born: What Happened Next?
programme.desc: Three couples who have featured on the programme share their experiences of parenthood 12 months after they originally took part. A woman explains why it will not be easy for her partner to cope with looking after their child when she returns to work, and another couple voice their concerns about the effect that starting a family has had on their health. Meanwhile, Lucy seeks her husbands approval as she decides to resume her career as an opera singer

programme.title: The Supervet
programme.desc: Noel Fitzpatrick offers cutting-edge treatment for Luca, a long-suffering four-year-old springer spaniel with a painful elbow disease. He designs and creates a special screw for Lucas leg with a system for injecting a bone-growth gel around it, and after an eight-year-old Newfoundland collapses, its owners face an agonising wait for the MRI scans to reveal if anything can be done for the gentle giant

programme.title: The Supervet
programme.desc: Rescue Labrador Tom needs work with a serious wound on one of his front paws, and four-year-old French bulldog called Otis has suffered an accident while being chased by another dog. Professor Noel Fitzpatrick diagnoses a spinal problem high up in Otiss neck that requires surgery. Meanwhile, Bailey, a 10-year-old cocker spaniel, has quite a lot of pain in one of his hind limbs, but his owner wants to avoid surgery, and Noel needs to perform specialist imaging before he can offer any solutions

programme.title: Pete Wicks: For Dogs Sake
programme.sub-title: Terri, Esme and the Chi Family
programme.desc: Pete meets Lurcher Terri, whos terrified of the world and must learn to trust again, and helps settle a family of chihuahuas given up by their heartbroken owner

programme.title: Inside the Ambulance
programme.desc: Adam and Jenine try to help a woman whos fallen from a first-floor window, while Laura and Natalie deal with a former paramedic who appears to have had a stroke

programme.title: Inside the Ambulance
programme.desc: Joel and Sam treat a woman whos in excruciating pain after tripping and injuring her leg, while Adam and Annie blue light to the scene of a car crash

programme.title: Inside the Operating Theatre
programme.desc: Twenty-one-year-old Ben needs his gall bladder removing as a result of losing 11 stone, while AJ is having an operation to free the painful compressed nerves in her toes

programme.title: Inside the Operating Theatre
programme.desc: Connie needs a polyp taking from her womb, Carl is undergoing keyhole surgery to remove torn cartilage from his knee and Brad is having a varicose vein stripped from his leg

programme.title: One Born Every Minute
programme.desc: Sooze found the birth of her first baby easy and confidently arrives at Southmead with her husband Joe, but the contractions quickly get the better of her. Teri and Merv, who are about to have their fourth child, talk about the cravings Teri has experienced this time round, while Becki and Ian nervously await their new arrival, having finally committed to each other following an on-off romance

programme.title: Interior Design Masters with Alan Carr
programme.desc: Michelle Ogundehin splits the contestants into three teams, each of which is given an open-plan office space to transform for a technology client, a sustainable beauty brand and a media team. The brief is to create a work space, a break-out space and a meeting space within the office, and Michelle will be looking for both displays of signature style and work that suits the needs of the client

programme.title: Amanda and Alans Italian Job
programme.desc: Many hands make light work as Amanda Holden and Alan Carr invite local friends Fabrizio, Maria Pia and Carlos over for a plastering party, but things soon get out of hand as a spillage nearly ruins their newly laid terrazzo floor. On a shopping trek in the coastal city of Trapani, Amanda seeks modern soft furnishings for the living room, while Alan hunts for antique knick-knacks in the old town. Both reunite to style the newly designed space and reveal their labour of love, aka Casa Alamanda, to their Sicilian family

programme.title: Louis Theroux: Transgender Kids
programme.desc: Louis travels to San Francisco, where pioneering medical professionals are helping children who say they were born in the wrong body to transition from one sex to the other. At the Child and Adolescent Gender Centre at UCSF Hospital, he meets youngsters who have been diagnosed with gender dysphoria and who are undergoing medical interventions, from puberty blockers to hormone-replacement therapy and ultimately gender-reassignment surgery. Louis spends time with the clinics patients and their families as they negotiate their way along this life-changing and emotional journey

programme.title: Great American Railroad Journeys
programme.desc: The final leg of Michael Portillos journey begins in Edmonton, where he learns about the people who 300 years ago travelled huge distances by foot and canoe to trade with indigenous people. He also admires the citys early 20th-century streetcars, preserved by the Radial Railway Society, and its light rail system. Moving on, he views the Rocky Mountains, marvels at the scale of Canadas forestry industry and discovers how the beaver, once slaughtered for its fur, is now pampered

programme.title: Great Continental Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Armed with a 1936 edition of Bradshaws Continental Railway Guide, Michael Portillo ventures onto the European rail network, beginning an emotional rail journey which takes him deep into his familys past. In the golden city of Salamanca in northwestern Spain, Michael visits the University to hear of opposition to the fascist takeover of Spain by General Francisco Franco, and gains access to the Generals archive of enemies of the state. Travelling onto the capital city of Madrid, Michael hears how the bombing of a small town in the Basque region in 1937 inspired one of the 20th centurys most shocking works of art, before making his way to the town of Huesca. Michaels final stop is on the border with France at Canfranc station, where he learns of the role the old terminus played in the evacuation of Jews during the Second World War

programme.title: American Pickers: Best Of
programme.desc: Mike and Frank find some treasures from the 1960s

programme.title: American Pickers: Best Of
programme.desc: Mike and Frank deal with some winter weather in their search for treasures

programme.title: Bangers and Cash: Restoring Classics
programme.desc: The Restos team try their hardest not to go too far on an Opel Manta. And a Peugeot 205 GTI brings back happy B-road memories for a mechanic who owned one

programme.title: One Foot in the Grave
programme.desc: The Meldrews broaden their cultural horizons with a visit to the BBC in the company of a comatose window cleaner they think is Mrs Warboys cousin. Later, Victor makes a fresh start with a new job - but soon blots his copybook with a characteristic outburst. Comedy, starring Richard Wilson

programme.title: One Foot in the Grave
programme.desc: Patricks cherry tree launches an attack on Victors junipers, which prompts the pensioner to seek professional help. Victors interest in tropical fish arouses the interest of the local Greenpeace branch. The Meldrews are alarmed when a hole appears at the bottom of their garden. Comedy, starring Richard Wilson, Annette Crosbie and Angus Deayton. From January 1993

programme.title: One Foot in the Grave
programme.desc: Long-suffering Margaret finally collapses with exhaustion, so Victor tries to nurse her back to health - but his bedside manner only makes matters worse. Comedy, starring Richard Wilson and Annette Crosbie

programme.title: One Foot in the Grave
programme.desc: A power cut on a sweltering summer night gives Victor and Margaret time to reflect on their lives together and look forward, without enthusiasm, to a visit from their elderly neighbours. Richard Wilson, Annette Crosbie and Roy Hudd star

programme.title: One Foot in the Grave
programme.desc: Victor is invited to talk about evolution at the Womens Institute, and finds plenty of inspiration when he decides to take up fishing. Meanwhile, Pippa is left shattered after a three-week visit by Patricks equally stuffy brother. Comedy, starring Richard Wilson and Annette Crosbie

programme.title: One Foot in the Grave
programme.desc: After years of frustrated anger and railing against the system, Victor Meldrew breathes his last I dont believe it after falling victim to a hit-and-run driver. At first, it seems as if the shock of his death will take a long time to settle for long-suffering Margaret

programme.title: Fred Dibnahs World of Steam, Steel and Stone
programme.sub-title: The Machines That Changed the World
programme.desc: The steeplejacks interest in the machines of the Industrial Revolution, an enthusiasm that has helped to elevate the profile of this significant period in British history. Includes interviews with the Bolton mans family and friends

programme.title: Fred Dibnahs World of Steam, Steel and Stone
programme.desc: A profile of some of the steeplejacks favourite Victorian engineers, reflecting his interest in their belief in the importance of hard work and enterprise. The documentary also highlights how Freds idols eventually received greater recognition for their achievements

programme.title: Fred Dibnahs World of Steam, Steel and Stone
programme.desc: Recalling the Bolton steeplejacks love of 19th-century life, which he said he wished he had lived through. The programme also looks at his admiration for great engineering and architecture, heading to locations such as Tower Bridge and Eastnor Castle

programme.title: Fred Dibnahs Made in Britain
programme.desc: Fred meets fellow traction engine enthusiasts in Staffordshire and visits an old friend who is restoring a triple expansion engine at Bratch Pumping Station. He also takes a tour of the trains on the Severn Valley railway and learns about the history of mining in the Black Country at the Living Museum

programme.title: Fred Dibnahs Made in Britain
programme.desc: Fred watches a traditional chain-maker at work and visits a copper mine, before discovering how the metal sheets produced would be transformed through a spinning process. He also takes a trip to the Ffestiniog railway, built to transport slate, where he rides on the footplate of a 19th-century train and sees the worlds oldest working steam engine

programme.title: Bangers and Cash
programme.desc: Daves in Lincolnshire picking up a 1935 Riley Falcon - a good-looking saloon car, with a pre-select gearbox

programme.title: Bangers and Cash
programme.desc: Derek brings a small army of military hardware to Thornton le Dale including a Studebaker Weasel tracked vehicle and a WWII-era Willys Jeep

programme.title: Bangers and Cash: Restoring Classics
programme.desc: The Restos team try their hardest not to go too far on an Opel Manta. And a Peugeot 205 GTI brings back happy B-road memories for a mechanic who owned one

programme.title: Bangers and Cash
programme.desc: Paul collects a cherished 1924 Rover 9 thats been in the same family since the 1950s and only had one previous owner before that

programme.title: Bangers and Cash
programme.desc: Derek casts his eye over a Citroen 2CV, before he is off admiring the treasure trove of more than 270 motorbikes in the same garage

programme.title: Bangers and Cash
programme.desc: Derek heads off to collect some vintage motorcycles from a garage at the bottom of the garden in the North-East of England

programme.title: Bangers and Cash
programme.desc: Dave finds two rare Fiats and a VW Corrado. Derek has his work cut out trying to remove an old Morris that appears to be supporting the garage roof. What could possibly go wrong?

programme.title: Bangers and Cash
programme.desc: Derek navigates the dry stone walls of the Peak District to collect a very original 1988 Opel Manta. Plus, Dave deals with a Ford Granada rally support vehicle

programme.title: Bangers and Cash
programme.desc: Derek has a three-hour drive in a 1960s bus that arrived in the UK after a life in the sun. Dave takes a Triumph TR7 convertible to auction

Seema Jaswal is joined by Ian Wright and Anita Asante to present coverage of the international friendly at Etihad Stadium in Manchester. These nations last met in the 2023 Womens Finalissima at Wembley, where England, the European Champions, defeated the South American Champions on penalties after the game ended in a 1-1 draw. Two years later, both teams once again hold their respective continental titles, with England having won the UEFA Womens Championship twice and Brazil now the nine-time champions of the Copa America Femenina. With commentary by Seb Hutchinson and Lucy Ward, and reports from Katie Shanahan

programme.title: Irelands Thalidomide Scandal
programme.desc: The thalidomide scandal in Ireland, which is considered one of the countrys longest-running medical tragedies. The flawed drug was used in the 1960s to treat morning sickness and as a sedative for pregnant women and teething infants. It was sold over the counter under various brand names, and was also available from general practitioners and in hospitals, surgeries and maternity homes. Unfortunately, it led to numerous children being born with a range of severe deformities

programme.desc: Magazine programme featuring health, safety and education reports, entertainment news and interviews with personalities making the headlines

programme.title: Marcus Wareings Tales from a Kitchen Garden
programme.desc: The Michelin-starred chef explores new possibilities at his East Sussex smallholding, heading off to the Knepp in Horsham to learn all about different tomato varieties in its impressive market garden. After losing some of his ducks to foxes, Marcus is determined to keep the rest safe and local expert Tom. has interesting and unexpected ideas, including introducing some noisy new arrivals

programme.title: Paul OGrady: For the Love of Dogs
programme.desc: The comedian meets a British bulldog that has a mysterious problem with its hind legs and has to go for an MRI scan. The staff are also busy hand-rearing nine newborn Jack Russell-Staffy cross pups, and Paul helps wash a smelly English mastiff with a skin condition

programme.title: Live Racing
programme.desc: Oli Bell presents coverage of a meeting headlined by the Old Roan Chase from Aintree, plus racing from Wincanton and Galway. With analysis from Tom Scudamore and Mick Fitzgerald, reports by Luke Harvey, and commentary from Mark Johnson

programme.title: Champions: Full Gallop
programme.desc: It is Boxing Day at Kempton and the stage is set for a Christmas showdown like no other. A sold-out crowd roars with anticipation as the unbeaten Constitution Hill and brilliant Irish mare Lossiemouth prepare to face off in the Christmas Hurdle. The build-up has been intense - as two of the best jockeys in the saddle also go head-to-head, who will triumph?

programme.title: Call the Cleaners
programme.desc: Shaun and his team are called out by a landlady who found her property in a very bad state, with mess over the floors, graffiti on the walls and doors pulled off their hinges. Maxine and her daughter Jasmine encounter a mountain of cigarette butts while cleaning the house of a man whose life fell apart following the breakup of his marriage, while sisters Yvonne and Angela tackle a bedsit with an infestation of German cockroaches

programme.title: News at 5.30
programme.desc: The latest national and international news stories from the Virgin Media News team

programme.title: The Chase Celebrity Special
programme.desc: Bradley Walsh presents as celebrity contestants Mark Chapman, Gillian Joseph, Ryan Sidebottom and Fred MacAulay pit their wits against one of the ruthless Chasers in the hope of winning a potential prize pot worth thousands of pounds. They must work as a team and play strategically to answer general knowledge questions against the clock and race down the game board to the exit without being caught

programme.title: Who Wants to Be a Millionaire?
programme.desc: Another line-up of contestants answer questions that could change their lives - with lifelines, including Ask the Audience, Phone a Friend and 50-50 available to them if they get stuck

programme.title: A Rebel Education
programme.desc: This look at the joyous, complicated and messy world of secondary school education continues. Glamour queen Nicole is struggling to stay in school, Alannah has to make some big life decisions and rising athletic star Giselle gets ready for the race of her life

programme.title: Living with Lucy
programme.desc: Lucy settles in with celebrity garden designer and TV personality Diarmuid Gavin, who talks about his turbulent relationship with fame and finding happiness in his family

programme.title: Faithless
programme.desc: Sam, Zein and Cormac have a boys night out planned. Nancy acts as Cupid for Sam with Miss Malone. The night is cut short when Uncle Gamals panic alarm goes off. Comedy drama, starring Baz Ashmawy and Amir El-Masry

programme.title: Dinner with the Enemy
programme.desc: A new diner joins the table, amid the possibility that new blood will shake the group. Power is tested at the end of this episode as one diner is voted Head of the Table

programme.title: Trauma Room One
programme.desc: Life in the UKs busiest neurology and neurosurgery hospital. A patient is sped into theatre after a stroke. Lorna is rushed in for emergency surgery after breaking her back. A consultant neurosurgeon must act quickly to avoid paralysis

programme.title: Finding Jack Charlton
programme.desc: Gabriel Clarke presents a profile of the World Cup-winning footballer, looking at his special relationship with Ireland after becoming the national teams manager, his complicated relationship with brother Bobby, and his final battle with dementia. With contributions from his wife Pat and son John, alongside celebrated Irish players, musicians, writers and politicians, including Larry Mullen, Roddy Doyle, Brendan OCarroll, Paul McGrath, Niall Quinn, Mick McCarthy, David OLeary and Andy Townsend

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: Lord Ashfordlys sister returns home with her new fiance in tow, but their arrival coincides with a series of jewel thefts in the village. Greengrass makes a splash in the decorating business, while Mike and Bellamy throw a lively party. Bill Maynard and Jason Durr star

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: Blaketon is appointed to the post of nuclear warning officer, sending Greengrass on a mission to save the village should the unthinkable happen. The safety of Aidensfield is also threatened elsewhere _ as a consequence of a secret factory operation. Rural drama, starring Bill Maynard, Derek Fowlds and Jason Durr

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: Mike gets embroiled in a romantic liaison with a bereaved local, which does not go down too well with Craddock, who sends him on leave. The villagers club together to lay on a French-themed party for Ginas birthday, but the bonhomie is sadly lacking. Rural drama, starring Derek Fowlds, Jason Durr and Tricia Penrose

programme.title: Lewis
programme.desc: The murder of a babysitter throws up a number of questions for Lewis and Hathaway - was she the intended victim or was the killer targeting her employers? Was the crime calculated or opportunistic? And why was she elaborately tied up after being murdered? As the detectives dig for clues, they are led into a world of suburban swinging and fetish photography, far removed from the Oxford they know. Gary Kemp (The Krays), Lucy Cohu (The Awakening), Ciaran McMenamin (Primeval) and Georgia Taylor (Casualty) guest star

programme.title: Emmerdale
programme.desc: Robert is in a quandary, while Joe Tate wants tougher justice and Liam launches his prostate-checking campaign

programme.title: Emmerdale
programme.desc: Joe has an accident, creating tensions, while Aaron makes an announcement and Dylan struggles to please everyone

programme.title: Emmerdale
programme.desc: There is a situation at the depot, Nicola is determined to get justice and Mandy is concerned for the newlyweds

programme.title: Emmerdale

programme.title: Emmerdale
programme.desc: There are new housemates for someone, while Dylan feels trapped and Caleb pays off a problem

programme.title: Agatha Christies Poirot
programme.desc: The detective finds himself investigating the strange and gruesome murder of an elderly psychiatrist. Elsewhere, Poirots old friend Ariadne Oliver is being pressed to uncover the truth behind two decade-old deaths. As the pair dig deep for evidence, they soon discover that their separate investigations are linked and join forces to solve the overarching mystery. David Suchet, Zoe Wanamaker and Greta Scacchi star

programme.title: Marcus Wareings Tales from a Kitchen Garden
programme.desc: The chef continues his plans for developing his smallholding, taking a masterclass in hedge laying and trying his hand at ploughing. He also pickles carrots for the local food bank

programme.title: Marcus Wareings Tales from a Kitchen Garden
programme.desc: The chef decides to use the surplus apples from the orchard to make his own cider. He also visits an edible food forest, inspiring him to grow his own back home

programme.title: How to Lose Weight Well
programme.sub-title: From the Sirtfood to the Yoga Diet
programme.desc: Doctors Helen Lawal and Javid Abdelmoneim help people try out the most popular diets on the market, with participants being put on a variety of regimens. Sisters Lesley and Debra from Essex road-test diets followed by celebrities Adele and Rebel Wilson, while friends Temi and Bose try out intermittent fasting, and drinking pals Maurice and Mick want to lose weight before attempting a Three Peaks walk in their native Yorkshire

programme.title: Coronation Street: Happy Birthday Bill
programme.desc: To commemorate his 90th birthday, cameras follow Coronation Street legend William Roache in the build-up to his special day, with appearances from cast members past and present

programme.title: Home Fires
programme.desc: The impact of the war begins to be felt in Great Paxford as the women are forced to make sacrifices for the salvage effort. But soon matters on the personal front replace their efforts on the home front as Kate and Jacks relationship intensifies, Pats marriage deteriorates and Claire finally plucks up the courage to ask Spencer out - unaware he is hiding a secret that could ruin their relationship before it has even started. Meanwhile, Alison resorts to desperate measures to pay a bill, and soon realises her actions will cost her much more. Wartime drama, with Claire Rushbrook, Daisy Badger, Rachel Hurd-Wood and Fenella Woolgar

programme.title: Appropriate Adult
programme.desc: Part one of two. Drama telling the story of how serial killers Fred and Rosemary West were brought to justice. In 1994 the life of Gloucestershire voluntary worker Janet Leach is turned upside down when she is asked by police to sit in on interviews as an independent safeguard on behalf of a man they have arrested. Within minutes he makes a shocking confession of murder. From then on she is drawn into the centre of the investigation and a complex personal relationship with West, who tells her information about other victims that she cannot pass on to the authorities because of her obligation of confidentiality to him. Starring Emily Watson, Dominic West, Monica Dolan and Robert Glenister

programme.title: Our House
programme.desc: Fi is left reeling by Brams apparent involvement in the house sale. Meanwhile, in the past, Bram frantically covers up his part in the accident whilst trying to mend his relationship with Fi. Thriller, starring Tuppence Middleton and Martin Compston

programme.title: Fried Green Tomatoes
programme.desc: An unfulfilled housewife who is neglected by her husband pays a visit to a nursing home, where she meets a spirited old lady with a fondness for telling tall tales. Her new friend inspires her to turn her life around with the story of two unconventional women at the helm of a restaurant in Depression-era Alabama. Drama, starring Kathy Bates, Jessica Tandy, Mary-Louise Parker and Mary Stuart Masterson

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: Mike clashes with no-nonsense new solicitor Jackie Lambert over a contested will, while Greengrass becomes a landlord _ whose first client turns out to be Bellamy. Rural drama, starring Jason Durr and Bill Maynard

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: Maggie is left questioning her marriage to Neil when he is accused of indecent conduct, while he is furious she could ever think he would do something like that. Elsewhere, Greengrass comes a cropper after organising a Civil War re-enactment, prompting unlikely hero Alf to step into the breach

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: A pregnant woman fears for the safety of her unborn child when a series of ghostly events convinces her the house is haunted. The Craddocks and Boltons fight it out in the Christmas charity dance. Drama, starring Jason Durr, Mark Jordon and Philip Franks

programme.title: Lewis
programme.desc: A visiting American academic delivers a controversial speech, with many audience members worried his ideas could be used to target ethnic minorities. So when he is found hanged the next morning and Dr Hobson quickly discounts suicide, Lewis and Hathaway realise they have many suspects - from the local anti-racism activist who was first in voicing her disgust at the professors beliefs to the women who had bombarded him with threatening e-mails. But then another body turns up and the case takes on a new dimension. David Soul and Patrick Baladi guest star

programme.title: Coronation Street
programme.desc: Dev pours his heart out to Glenda, Christina tries to help an exhausted George, Theo reacts badly to Petes flirting, and Roy catches Lisa and Becky getting cosy on the sofa

programme.title: Agatha Christies Poirot
programme.desc: The sleuth is reunited with sidekick Captain Hastings (Hugh Fraser), secretary Miss Lemon (Pauline Moran) and Inspector Japp (Philip Jackson) in a case that plunges him into the world of global espionage as the Second World War looms. The public are in panic after the shocking death of Russian grandmaster Ivan Savaranoff during a game of chess. Poirot must try to determine the good guys from the bad in a complex plot that sees the main figures used like pawns. David Suchet stars in a story adapted by Mark Gatiss and Ian Hallard

programme.title: Britains Biggest Hoarders
programme.desc: Having faced a lifelong struggle trying to help her hoarder mum, Jasmine Harman sets out to help other families struggling with this condition

programme.title: How to Lose Weight Well
programme.sub-title: From the Coffee to the Korean K-Pop Diet
programme.desc: Part two of two. Dr Javid Abdelmoneim reports on how the diet industry has adopted technology and takes a gym bike for a spin, as six more volunteers put the most popular diets to the test. Old friends Heena and Dhruti take on the coffee and chocolate diets, father and son Joe and Jad try the Mexican and K-pop diet diets, while Joan and Rosie get to grips with the macro diet and a smart app diet

programme.title: Judi Loves Culinary Cruise
programme.desc: The presenter stops at the archaeological site of Delphi in Greece, where she visits its famous ruins, meets the inhabitants of a bee farm, and tastes their honey. Judi also visits a family run bakery, where she makes the famous kaitafi dessert with owner Sophocles, has a party with pastry, and cooks up a dish of honey and rum peaches with mini doughnuts

programme.title: Titanic
programme.desc: The story returns to the beginning, to the Belfast shipyard where political strife interferes with the Titanics construction, prompting the designer to offer electrical engineer Jim Maloney steerage passage on the liner - if he and his team can finish the wiring on time. A month later, as the passengers board, Jim meets a mysterious passenger who unsettles his wife, while in second class, Muriel Batley bitterly resents her husband Johns fawning to the Earl and reveals she knows a secret about his employer. But their worries are overshadowed by a looming iceberg and a chaotic scramble for the lifeboats. Drama, starring Toby Jones, Maria Doyle Kennedy and Peter McDonald

programme.title: Finders Keepers
programme.desc: Shaken by his fatal confrontation with Denys, Martin confesses all to Anne, who hatches a bold plan to save her family and bring Josh home. After persuading Rocky to break into Denyss house, Martin informs the police that he believes a robbery is about to take place. All seems well - until Laura calls off the wedding

programme.title: Michael Palin in North Korea
programme.desc: The actor presents the first of two programmes documenting life for many of the millions who live, work and have families in North Korea. Michaels arrival coincides with the historic meeting between North Korean leader Kim Jong-Un and South Korean president Moon Jae-In, as he embarks on a journey of some 1,300 miles of the reclusive nation south to north, visiting sites and locations rarely explored by Westerners, determined to spend time with everyday Korean citizens from all walks of life

programme.title: Poldark
programme.desc: Several months have passed and Ross has got in deeper with the French invasion force as they prepare to welcome their leader General Toussaint. Meanwhile, Morwenna and Drake are ready to welcome their baby, while George stumbles on the means to undo Ross once and for all with the help of Merceron and Hanson. Ross and his friends must launch their most daring plan yet to try to save themselves and the country from enemies both at home and abroad. Last-ever episode of the drama, starring Aidan Turner

programme.title: The Doctor Blake Mysteries
programme.desc: The medic investigates the death of a strangled young gypsy girl, and must tread carefully as prejudice rears its head. Drama, starring Craig MacLachlan

programme.desc: Behind-the-scenes look at one of the UKs busiest transport hubs, chronicling the issues that face station staff, transport workers, emergency services, commuters and tourists

programme.title: Harbour Cops
programme.desc: Documentary following the daily work of Dyfed-Powys Police officers over the busy summer months. Dyfed-Powys is the smallest police force in the UK, but has to patrol the largest police area, their jurisdiction taking in national parks and a lengthy run of the spectacular South Wales coastline. In this first episode, officers in the seaside town of Tenby on the western side of Carmarthen Bay have to deal with rowdy holidaymakers causing trouble and track down a pensioner who has been reported missing

programme.title: Snowpiercer
programme.desc: Melanie intensifies her search for Layton, who is weaponizing her secret. The Third Class face a reckoning when Layton presents them with a choice

programme.desc: The host is joined by reality star and businesswoman Kim Kardashian and award-winning actress Sarah Paulson, who are appearing together in the new TV legal drama Alls Fair. Breaking Bad star Bryan Cranston chats about taking to the West End stage in All My Sons, while actress and singer Rachel Zegler also appears, fresh from wowing audiences at the London Palladium in Evita. Plus, Little Simz performs Lion, from her album Lotus

programme.title: Flightplan
programme.desc: A widow boards a plane with her daughter and promptly falls asleep. When she wakes up, the girl has disappeared - and the mothers fear turns to outright panic when the aircraft crew insists she boarded the flight alone, suggesting the child is merely a figment of her distressed imagination. Thriller, starring Jodie Foster, Peter Sarsgaard, Sean Bean and Greta Scacchi
